abilities.name: Shadow Command
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw 2 cards. If you have 7 or more cards in your hand, discard a number of cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. Then, put 2 damage counters on Dusknoir. This power can't be used if Dusknoir is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Damage Even
attacks.text: Count the number of damage counters on Dusknoir. Put that many damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Night Spin
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Dusknoir by your opponent's Pokémon that has 2 or less Energy attached to it during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Emperor Aura
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Empoleon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Active Pokémon, you may use this power. Your opponent can't attach any Energy cards from his or her hand to his or her Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Empoleon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Blaze Dance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Infernape from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 4 Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Close Combat
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Infernape by attacks is increased by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Spreading Fire
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Infernape and this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Fin Luster
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Lumineon is your Active Pokémon, you may look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent's Bench isn't full, choose 1 Basic Pokémon from your opponent's hand, and put it onto his or her Bench. Then, switch it with the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Lumineon is affected by a Special Condition. 0 Quick Swim Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Elegant Swim
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Lumineon during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Magnetic Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Lightning or Metal Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Speed Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crush Volt
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Magnezone.

abilities.name: Super Connectivity
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Lightning or Metal Energy card and attach it to your Active Pokémon. Then, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Gyro Ball
attacks.text: You may switch Magnezone with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Horror Chant
attacks.text: If your opponent has 4 or more Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and return that Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Split Ball
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to Raichu to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Burst Ball
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to any of your Pokémon in any way you like.

abilities.name: Regi Form
abilities.text: If you have Regirock, Regice, and Registeel in play, the attack cost of Regigigas's attacks is Colorless less.

attacks.name: Giga Power
attacks.text: You may do 60 damage plus 40 more damage. If you do, Regigigas does 40 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Energy Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), move a Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Sceptile is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poison Leaf
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Slice Drain
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Sceptile.

abilities.name: Sunshine Song
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Torterra from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may choose as many of your Grass Pokémon in play as you like. For each Grass Pokémon you choose, search your deck for an Evolution card that evolves from that Pokémon and evolve it. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Crash Impact
attacks.text: Torterra does 20 damage to itself. Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Land Shake
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, when your opponent puts a Basic Pokémon from his or her hand onto his or her Bench, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

abilities.name: Snow Veil
abilities.text: As long as Abomasnow is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Snow Play
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, excluding Grass Pokémon and Water Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Below Zero
attacks.text: If Abomasnow evolved from Snover during this turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Cycler
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. Then, search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Bronzong is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Strange Spin
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Heavy Potential
attacks.text: Put a number of damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon equal to the number of Colorless Energy in that Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).

abilities.name: Sunny Day
abilities.text: Each of your Grass Pokémon's and Fire Pokémon's attacks does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). 0 Salty-sweet Pollen 20 Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cross Poison
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If 2 or more of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Derail
attacks.text: Discard all Special Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ominous Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Spirit Pulse
abilities.text: As long as Dusknoir is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it between turns.

attacks.name: Darkness Mist
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Fainting Spell
abilities.text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Gengar would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Shadow Room
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If that Pokémon has any Poké-Powers, put 6 damage counters on that Pokémon instead.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Trainer, Supporter, and Stadium cards in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Wreak Havoc
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card from your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dragon Beat
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card from each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Take Out
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't an Evolved Pokémon, that Pokémon is Knocked Out instead of damaged by this attack.

attacks.name: Hurricane Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Machamp.

attacks.name: Ramming Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads or you may start again. Each time you start again, put 2 damage counters on Mamoswine. (If Mamoswine would be Knocked Out, you can't start again.)

attacks.name: Parade
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Swinub on your Bench, plus 20 more damage for each Piloswine on your Bench, and 40 more damage for each Mamoswine on your Bench.

abilities.name: Burning Mane
abilities.text: If Rapidash is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Rapidash is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Shooting Fire
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Rapidash and choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Hidden Poison
abilities.text: If Roserade is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Roserade is Knocked Out), the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Bowed Whip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Deep Poison
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Battle Rush
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon in play that has maximum HP of 120 or more, ignore all Colorless Energy necessary to use Salamence's attacks.

attacks.name: Steam Twister
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy and a Water Energy attached to Salamence.

abilities.name: Honeycomb Defender
abilities.text: If Scizor has 6 or more damage counters on it, any damage done to Scizor by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Accelerate
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out by this attack, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Scizor during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Pound Down
attacks.text: If you don't have any Pokémon with any Poké-Powers in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Gas
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Skuntank from your hand to evolve 1 of your Active Pokémon, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. If that Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Protect Wing
abilities.text: As long as Staraptor is your Active Pokémon, any damage done by attacks from your opponent's Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Strong Breeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to it on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Outbreak Power
attacks.text: Choose a number of your opponent's Pokémon up to the amount of Energy attached to Steelix. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Green Renewal
abilities.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Tangrowth between turns.

attacks.name: Green Acid
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If the first coin is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If the second coin is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Reaching Vine
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Darkness Drive
abilities.text: After your opponent's Pokémon uses a Poké-Power, you may search your discard pile for a basic Darkness Energy card and attach it to Tyranitar.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Tyranitar.

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Green Dignity
abilities.text: As long as you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, Vespiquen's attacks do 10 more damage for each Grass Pokémon on your Bench to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bee Drain
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from Vespiquen the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bee Powder
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned.

abilities.name: Unaware
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, excluding damage, done to Bibarel.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Poison Enzyme
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Budew by your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Roselia from your hand onto Budew (this counts as evolving Budew) and remove all damage counters from Budew. 0 Buddy-buddy Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dark One-eye
attacks.text: You may discard a card from your hand. If you do, your opponent discards a card from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Trick Room
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, remove 2 damage counters from Dusclops.

abilities.name: Radiance
abilities.text: If Electrode is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Electrode is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Low Current
attacks.text: If Electrode was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Electro Diffusion
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to Electrode. Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electrode.

attacks.name: Go and Collect
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Tail Shake
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hoodwink
attacks.text: You may search your opponent's discard pile for up to 3 in any combination of Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards and put them into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Brick Break
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magnetic Resonance
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Magnetic Release
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Removal Pulse
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Energy Milk
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu. 0 Electric Circuit Search your discard pile for up to 4 Lightning Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Rouse
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Piloswine. Then, remove 4 damage counters from Piloswine.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Energy Protection
abilities.text: Any damage done to Pupitar by attacks is reduced by 10 for each Energy attached to Pupitar (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't reduce more than 30 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Overeager
abilities.text: If Sableye is your Active Pokémon at the beginning of the game, you go first. (If each player's Active Pokémon has the Overeager Poké-Body, this power does nothing.) 0 Impersonate Search your deck for a Supporter card and discard it. Shuffle your deck afterward. Then, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Overconfident
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Sableye, this attack's base damage is 40.

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slashing Strike attack's base damage is 60.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther can't use Slashing Strike.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Mach Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Shot Air
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Scary Face
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Self-abandonment
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to the Defending Pokémon. If tails, Bidoof does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Gyro Swap
attacks.text: Put a number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon equal to the number of Colorless Energy in Bronzor's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Bullet Seed
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Alert
attacks.text: Draw a card. Then, you may switch Combee with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Constrict
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Silhouette
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon. If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon instead.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Mouth Pump
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Trick Gas
attacks.text: You may switch Gastly with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Knock Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magnetic Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Magnemite does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Nightmare Feast
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 50 damage and remove 5 damage counters from Misdreavus. If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Onix would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Onix if that damage is 40 or less.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Speed Bolt
attacks.text: If Pikachu evolved from Pichu during this turn, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Pikachu during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Ponyta during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Petal Spikes
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. If Budew is anywhere under Roselia, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Stalk
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Dangerous Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Snover during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Gnaw and Run
attacks.text: Switch Stunky with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Swinub does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Ingrain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to Tangela. Shuffle your deck afterward. If you do, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Tangela during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Tickle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Outlet
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Bouncing Ball
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Voltorb does 10 damage to itself.

name: Conductive Quarry
rules: Once during each player's turn, the player may flip a coin. If heads, that player searches his or her discard pile for a Lightning or Metal Energy card, shows it to the opponent, and puts it into his or her hand.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Energy Link
rules: As long as Energy Link is attached to a Pokémon, you may move an Energy card attached to that Pokémon to another of your Pokémon that has Energy Link attached to it. You may use this effect as often as you like during your turn.

name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Luxury Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon (excluding Pokémon LV.X), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If any Luxury Ball is in your discard pile, you can't play this card.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Marley's Request
rules: You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Poké Blower +
rules: You may play 2 Poké Blower + at the same time. If you play 1 Poké Blower +, flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you play 2 Poké Blower +, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Poké Drawer +
rules: You may play 2 Poké Drawer + at the same time. If you play 1 Poké Drawer +, draw a card. If you play 2 Poké Drawer +, search your deck for up to 2 cards, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Poké Healer +
rules: You may play 2 Poké Healer + at the same time. If you play 1 Poké Healer +, remove 1 damage counter and a Special Condition from 1 of your Active Pokémon. If you play 2 Poké Healer +, remove 8 damage counters and all Special Conditions from 1 of your Active Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Premier Ball
rules: Search your deck or your discard pile for a Pokémon LV.X, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If you search your deck, shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Cyclone Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. When you play this card from your hand and attach it to your Active Pokémon, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

name: Warp Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.When you attach this card from your hand to your Active Pokémon, switch that Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Ectoplasm
abilities.text: If Dusknoir is your Active Pokémon and would be Knocked Out by damage from your opponent's attack, you may discard all cards attached to Dusknoir LV.X and put Dusknoir LV.X as a Stadium card into play instead of discarding it. This counts as Dusknoir being Knocked Out and your opponent takes a Prize card. As long as you have Dusknoir LV.X as a Stadium card in play, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon between turns. If another Stadium card comes into play or Dusknoir LV.X is discarded by the effects of any attacks, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, Trainer, or Supporter cards, return Dusknoir LV.X to your hand.

abilities.name: Heat Metal
abilities.text: Your opponent can't remove the Special Condition Burned by evolving or devolving his or her Burned Pokémon. (This also includes putting a Pokémon Level-Up card onto the Burned Pokémon.) Whenever your opponent flips a coin for the Special Condition Burned between turns, treat it as tails.

abilities.name: Heat Wave
abilities.text: Once at the end of your turn, if Heatran is on your Bench, you may use this power. If you discarded basic Energy cards attached to your Fire or Metal Active Pokémon by using that Pokémon's attack this turn, attach up to 2 of those Energy cards to that Pokémon.

abilities.name: No Guard
abilities.text: As long as Machamp is your Active Pokémon, each of Machamp's attacks does 60 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance) and any damage done to Machamp by your opponent's Pokémon is increased by 60 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Strong-Willed
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Machamp would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, Machamp is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

abilities.name: Link Lightning
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Raichu LV.X onto Raichu and use Voltage Shoot, you may use another attack of Raichu afterward. This power can't be used if Raichu is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Voltage Shoot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Lightning Energy cards from your hand and choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 80 to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Sacrifice
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of your Pokémon in play and that Pokémon is Knocked Out. Then, search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, attach them to Regigigas, and remove 8 damage counters from Regigigas. This power can't be used if Regigigas is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giga Blaster
attacks.text: Discard the top card from your opponent's deck. Then, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it. Regigigas can't use Giga Blaster during your next turn.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmander in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon in order to use this attack.

abilities.name: Energy Burn
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard in order to use this attack.
